skill.name: code-conventions
skill.description: Guide for code conventions and formatting
skill.summary: Guide for code conventions and formatting
skill.author: 5t111111

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown-based skill containing only documentation guidelines. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem access, and no external commands. This is a safe, prompt-only skill that provides code convention guidance.

content.user_title: Apply code conventions and formatting standards
content.value_statement: Inconsistent code formatting makes projects hard to read and maintain. This skill provides clear guidelines for code conventions and formatting, helping teams maintain clean, readable, and professional codebases.
actual_capabilities: Guides developers to run mise run fmt before committing
Requires JSDoc/TSDoc comments for all functions, classes, and properties
Specifies English as the documentation language
Provides formatting guidelines for Deno projects
limitations: Does not validate syntax or check code correctness
Does not provide custom configuration options

use_cases.title: Team code standards
use_cases.description: Establish consistent formatting and documentation rules across your development team

use_cases.title: Project contribution guide
use_cases.description: Define clear conventions for contributors to follow in open source projects

use_cases.title: Deno project conventions
use_cases.description: Apply Deno-specific formatting and documentation standards to your codebase

prompt_templates.title: Format code
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply code conventions. Format the code using mise run fmt and ensure all functions, classes, and properties have JSDoc/TSDoc comments.

prompt_templates.title: Document functions
prompt_templates.prompt: Add JSDoc/TSDoc comments to all undocumented functions, classes, and properties. Write all documentation in English.

prompt_templates.title: Review conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code against the code conventions. Check if mise run fmt has been run and if all symbols are documented with proper JSDoc/TSDoc comments.

prompt_templates.title: Create style guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a code conventions guide for this Deno project based on best practices. Include formatting rules with mise run fmt and documentation requirements with JSDoc/TSDoc.

output_examples.input: Format this code and add documentation
output: ‚úì Ran mise run fmt to format code
‚úì Added JSDoc comment to calculateTotal function
‚úì Added TSDoc comment to User class properties

best_practices: Run mise run fmt before every commit to maintain consistent formatting
Document all public symbols (functions, classes, properties) with JSDoc/TSDoc comments
Write all documentation comments in English for better accessibility
anti_patterns: Skipping formatting checks before committing code
Leaving functions, classes, or properties undocumented
Writing documentation comments in non-English languages

faq.question: Does this skill work with non-Deno projects?
faq.answer: The formatting guidance is Deno-specific but documentation rules apply to any JavaScript/TypeScript project.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code files?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance and recommendations only. It does not execute any code or modify files.

faq.question: Can I use this with VS Code or other editors?
faq.answer: Yes, the conventions can be applied in any editor. The mise run fmt command works from the command line.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reads your code locally to provide guidance. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: This skill provides human-readable guidelines. Linters are automated tools that enforce rules programmatically.

faq.question: Can I customize the conventions?
faq.answer: This skill provides fixed guidelines. For custom rules, you would need to configure your own formatter or linter settings.
